title: Use segment length to make dropdown responsive

body:
Above 600px, the dropdown has a min width of 240px, and a max width of 320px. The width of the dropdown will grow to match the longest segment name.

Below 600px, the width of the dropdown is fixed to the same size as the parent button.

fixes #21291

issue.title: Looking for a segment in the list of Segments is difficult because segment names are cut after just a few letters
issue.body:
Looking for a segment in the list of Segments is difficult because segment names are cut after just a few letters

Example of what i'm seeing:

![image](https://github.com/matomo-org/matomo/assets/466765/817a3acd-3c92-4f1b-96b2-4506f8e2aa08)

but here is no reason/benefit to make it so narrow.

So instead it would be great if the segment list was wider and showed maybe twice as many letters.

nodes.body: Should be quite easy to change the css a bit. Should we keep a fixed with of the dropdown, or maybe let it adjust automatically based on the segment names, while having a min and max width or similar?
I vote for the automatic width! ;-)
Automatic width based on name while having a min and max sounds reasonable to me too 👍
